meanings.definition: To expel or banish someone from their home country.
meanings.sent1: The king was exiling the traitor for betraying the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The government was exiling the criminal to ensure the safety of the citizens.
meanings.sent3: The villagers were exiling the noisy rooster to the far end of the farm.
meanings.sent4: The storm was exiling the leaves from the trees, scattering them across the yard.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was exiling distractions from the classroom to help students focus.

meanings.definition: To force someone to leave a place or situation.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise was exiling me from my peaceful thoughts.
meanings.sent2: The bad smell was exiling everyone from the room.
meanings.sent3: The rain was exiling the picnic from the park to indoors.
meanings.sent4: The bright light was exiling the shadows from the room.
meanings.sent5: The cold weather was exiling the birds to warmer regions.

meanings.definition: The act of banishing or expelling someone from a place.
meanings.sent1: The exiling of the criminal was necessary to maintain order in the town.
meanings.sent2: The exiling of the student from the classroom shocked the other students.
meanings.sent3: The exiling of the old furniture made room for the new ones.
meanings.sent4: The exiling of the weeds from the garden allowed the flowers to thrive.
meanings.sent5: The exiling of the ghost from the house brought peace to the family.
